text: [PH] Choose what fucker you're gonna fucking destroy
“They say the definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results. Ha, what do they know. I'm perfectly insane.”
“They say the definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over, what was i doing again?"
“They say the definition of... hmmm. What! What do you want, i'm not Insane!"

As the queen of the Lahmians, Neferata, you must decide the fate of your mortal vassal {{CcoCampaignEventDilemma:FirstTargetFactionNameWithIcon}}. Integrating them into your inner circle will ensure your direct control over their settlements. However, maintaining their vassal status would secure loyalty and stability, thus gaining their levies and potentially more benefits. Will you integrate this mortal vassal, encouraging cooperation but risking power struggles, or maintain their servant status for stability at the cost of their full potential?
They'll prosper under our direct rule

In her discreet, subtle way, Genevieve has managed to make {{CcoCampaignEventDilemma:FirstTargetFactionNameWithIcon}}'s leader reconsider the war waged on you. It only took a word here, a suggestion there, underlining costs and losses, stressing possible gains, the merest touch to sway their blood-thirsty drive. Blood spilled on the battlefield is wasted blood, after all.
As the warboss lays broken at your feet, you cannot help but marvel at this unlikely combination of Dhar and what the greenkins call Waaagh magic that Azhag wielded, and the potential it offered.

The Black Pyramid usually hovers leisurely over the landscape, but when time is of the essence, it may be fed warpstone to give it a burst of power allowing it to soar high and strike an unsuspecting target, bypassing any obstacle that would have otherwise protected it.
